intro: Achyrocline steetzii, commonly known as the Hawaiian false geranium, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
